intro: Neanotis formosana, commonly known as the Formosan nettle, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its stinging hairs on the leaves and stems, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Neanotis formosana is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
